alert.note: Alert for Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; North Sevier; Northwest Cocke; Sevier Smoky Mountains (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 4:39PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jefferson, southwestern Cocke and east central Sevier Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, or 9 miles south of Newport, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport, Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, Cosby, Hartford and Chestnut Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cocke Smoky Mountains; Jefferson; North Sevier; Northwest Cocke; Sevier Smoky Mountains
